I think this happens way more than people talk about, and it doesn't mean there's anything wrong with you or that your friends don't care about you. Sometimes group dynamics just get weird, or people get caught up in inside jokes or conversations that accidentally leave others out without them even realizing it.

If you feel comfortable, you could try jumping into conversations more or suggesting activities that include everyone. Sometimes I think people don't notice when someone's feeling left out because they're just focused on their own thing. You could also try talking to one of your friends individually - like maybe there's one person in the group you feel closest to who might be more aware of how you're feeling.

Is this something that's been building up for a while, or did it start happening recently?

query: I got asked out and I donâ€™t like them that way.

content.text:
Ugh, that's so awkward! ðŸ˜… It's one of those moments where you want to be nice but also don't want to give them the wrong idea, right? We've all been in that uncomfortable spot before.

The good news is this happens all the time, and most people understand that not everyone's gonna be into them romantically. I think the kindest thing you can do is just be honest but gentle about it. You could say something like "I'm really flattered, but I just see us as friends" or "Thanks for asking, but I'm not looking to date right now." 

I'd avoid making up excuses or being overly apologetic - it just makes things more confusing for everyone. A simple, direct answer is usually better than trying to soften it so much that they think they still have a chance. It might feel a little uncomfortable in the moment, but it's way better than leading them on.

How did they ask you out - was it super direct or more casual? And are you worried about things being weird between you two after?

query: I like two people at the same time and I feel guilty.

content.text:
Ugh, that's such a tough spot to be in! ðŸ˜… Having feelings for two people at once can make you feel all twisted up inside, and that guilt you're feeling? Totally normal - it doesn't make you a bad person at all.

Honestly, this happens way more than people talk about. Your heart doesn't always follow a neat little timeline, and sometimes feelings overlap in messy ways. The fact that you feel guilty actually shows you care about being honest and not hurting anyone, which says good things about you.

I think the important thing is figuring out what you actually want to do about it. If you're not officially dating either of them, you're not really doing anything wrong by having feelings. But if you are talking to both in a romantic way, it might be worth taking some time to think about which connection feels more real to you, or if you need to be upfront with them about where you're at. Sometimes just giving yourself permission to feel confused for a bit helps you figure out what you actually want.

Are you actively talking to both of them, or is this more about having feelings you're trying to sort through?

query: My parent read my diary/notes and I feel so violated.

content.text:
Oh no, I'm so sorry that happened to you! ðŸ’™ That feeling of violation is so real - your diary is like your most private space, and having someone read it without permission feels like such a betrayal of trust.

Honestly, what you're feeling right now is totally valid. It doesn't matter that they're your parent - everyone deserves some privacy, especially for something as personal as a diary. I get why you feel so angry and hurt about this.

I think it might help to have a conversation with them about boundaries when you're feeling a bit calmer. You could try something like "I understand you care about me, but reading my diary made me feel really violated. I need some private space to process my thoughts, and that's normal for someone my age." Sometimes parents don't realize how much it affects us because they think they're just looking out for us. If talking feels too hard right now, maybe you could write them a letter explaining how it made you feel.

Going forward, I'd maybe find a new hiding spot or consider keeping your most private thoughts in a password-protected notes app on your phone if you have one. It sucks that you have to do that, but at least it might give you back some of that safe space to vent.

How are you feeling about talking to them about it, or does that feel too overwhelming right now?

query: I feel like Iâ€™m doing my best and itâ€™s still not enough.

content.text:
I'm so sorry you're feeling that way right now. That's honestly one of the most exhausting feelings - when you're putting in all this effort and it still feels like you're falling short. I totally get why that would be so draining and discouraging.

The thing is, sometimes when we're in the thick of it, we can't see how much we're actually accomplishing. I think we're usually way harder on ourselves than anyone else would be, and "not enough" might not be as accurate as it feels in the moment. You're doing your best, and that really does count for something, even when the results aren't showing up the way you want them to.

I know it's easier said than done, but maybe try to give yourself a little credit for the effort you're putting in. Sometimes progress is super slow or happens in ways we don't immediately notice. It doesn't mean your hard work isn't making a difference - it might just not be visible yet.

What area of your life is making you feel this way the most right now - is it school stuff, relationships, or something else?
